item.title: Joe add a quote by Lou Holtz
item.description: "Do right. Do your best. Treat others as you want to be treated." -- Lou Holtz

item.title: Joe add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "The Constitution only guarantees the American people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Joe add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "Let us not forget who we are. Drug abuse is a repudiation of everything America is." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Joe add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her." -- George Washington

item.title: Joe add a quote by Pope John Paul II
item.description: "True freedom is not advanced in the permissive society, which confuses freedom with license to do anything whatever and which in the name of freedom proclaims a kind of general amorality. It is a caricature of freedom to claim that people are free to organize their lives with no reference to moral values, and to say that society does not have to ensure the protection and advancement of ethical values. Such an attitude is destructive of freedom and peace." -- Pope John Paul II

item.title: Joe add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Well done is better than well said." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Joe add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to be alone than in bad company." -- George Washington

item.title: Joe add a quote by Ty Cobb
item.description: "I've got to be first all the time — in everything." -- Ty Cobb

item.title: Joe add a quote by Wernher Von Braun
item.description: "We can lick gravity, but sometimes the paperwork is overwhelming." -- Wernher Von Braun

item.title: Joe add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Joe add a quote by Douglas MacArthur
item.description: "Few names have left a firmer imprint upon the pages of the history of American times than has that of Ty Cobb... he seems to have understood that in the competition of baseball, just as in war, defensive strategy never has produced ultimate victory." -- Douglas MacArthur

item.title: Joe add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "The fruit of silence is prayer, the fruit of prayer is faith, the fruit of faith is love, the fruit of love is service, the fruit of service is peace." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Joe add a quote by General Douglas MacArthur
item.description: "The soldier, above all others, prays for peace, for it is the soldier that must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war." -- General Douglas MacArthur

item.title: Joe add a quote by Douglas MacArthur
item.description: "Last, but by no means least, courage of one's convictions, the courage to see things through. The world is in a constant conspiracy against the brave. It's the age-old struggle_ the roar of the crowd on one side and the voice of your conscience on the other." -- Douglas MacArthur

item.title: Joe add a quote by Pope John Paul II
item.description: "Know what you are talking about." -- Pope John Paul II

item.title: Joe add a quote by Muhammad Ali Jinnah
item.description: "You are free; you are free to go to your temples. You are free to go to your mosques or to any other places of worship in this State of Pakistan. You may belong to any religion, caste or creed—that has nothing to do with the business of the State." -- Muhammad Ali Jinnah
